pullrequest.title: gazebo5: allow sdformat3 and fix tests

content.raw:
`gz_TEST.cc` was added in pull request #972 (warning, big pull request). The initial goal was to have tests for all the command-line tools. For `gzsdf` (now known as `gz sdf`), one of the desired tests was to verify that it properly printed the entire sdformat description (`gz sdf -d 1.4` for example). To verify this, the entire sdformat description was copied into a [header file](#!/osrf/gazebo/raw/b45e99a4c98dc0ae075b66f4b60f5c17aa6c424b/test/data/sdf_descriptions_expected.h) and a [string comparison was made](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/b45e99a4c98dc0ae075b66f4b60f5c17aa6c424b/tools/gz_TEST.cc?at=gzmodify#cl-601).

I had my own issues about the basic idea of that test (#1332), but storing the entire description as text had some impractical side effects. Without detailing those, we instead compute a `shasum` of the generated sdf description and compare to a hard-coded value.

I don't know of a table of sdformat compatibility.
content.html:
gz_TEST.cc was added in pull request #972 (warning, big pull request). The initial goal was to have tests for all the command-line tools. For gzsdf (now known as gz sdf), one of the desired tests was to verify that it properly printed the entire sdformat description (gz sdf -d 1.4 for example). To verify this, the entire sdformat description was copied into a header file and a string comparison was made.

I had my own issues about the basic idea of that test (#1332), but storing the entire description as text had some impractical side effects. Without detailing those, we instead compute a shasum of the generated sdf description and compare to a hard-coded value.

I don't know of a table of sdformat compatibility.
